translated: As It Was Said 78
As It Was Said🔽The Collection on Three Things
The third sub-chapter
The Discussion of Elements

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One:

original: “Dhātuso, bhikkhave, sattā sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandanti samenti.🔽Hīnādhimuttikā sattā hīnādhimuttikehi sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandanti samenti,
analyzed: dhātusas bhikkhave sattā sattehi saddhim sasandanti samenti  hīna adhimuttikā sattā hīna adhimuttikehi sattehi saddhim sasandanti samenti
translated: “Monks, it’s because of elements that beings come together and associate.🔽Beings of low disposition come together and associate with beings of low disposition.

original: kalyāṇādhimuttikā sattā kalyāṇādhimuttikehi sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandanti samenti.
analyzed: kalyāṇa adhimuttikā sattā kalyāṇa adhimuttikehi sattehi saddhim sasandanti samenti
translated: Beings of good disposition come together and associate with beings of good disposition.

original: Atītampi, bhikkhave, addhānaṁ dhātusova sattā sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandiṁsu samiṁsu.🔽Hīnādhimuttikā sattā hīnādhimuttikehi sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandiṁsu samiṁsu,
analyzed: atītam pi bhikkhave addhānam dhātuso uva sattā sattehi saddhim  hīna adhimuttikā sattā hīna adhimuttikehi sattehi saddhim
translated: In the past, too, it was because of elements that beings came together and associated.🔽Beings of low disposition came together and associated with beings of low disposition.

original: kalyāṇādhimuttikā sattā kalyāṇādhimuttikehi sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandiṁsu samiṁsu.
analyzed: kalyāṇa adhimuttikā sattā kalyāṇa adhimuttikehi sattehi saddhim
translated: Beings of good disposition came together and associated with beings of good disposition.

original: Anāgatampi, bhikkhave, addhānaṁ dhātusova sattā sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandissanti samessanti.
analyzed: anāgatam pi bhikkhave addhānam dhātuso uva sattāḥ sattehi saddhim sasandissanti samessanti
translated: In the future, too, it will be because of elements that beings will come together and associate.

original: Hīnādhimuttikā sattā hīnādhimuttikehi sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandissanti samessanti,
analyzed: hīna adhimuttikā sattā hīna adhimuttikehi sattehi saddhim sasandissanti samessanti
translated: Beings of low aspiration will come together and unite with beings of low aspiration.

original: kalyāṇādhimuttikā sattā kalyāṇādhimuttikehi sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandissanti samessanti.
analyzed: kalyāṇa adhimuttikā sattā kalyāṇa adhimuttikehi sattehi saddhim sasandissanti samessanti
translated: Beings of noble aspiration will come together and unite with beings of noble aspiration.

original: Etarahipi, bhikkhave, paccuppannaṁ addhānaṁ dhātusova sattā sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandanti samenti.
analyzed: etarahi pi bhikkhave paccuppannam addhānam dhātuso uva sattā sattehi saddhim sasandanti samenti
translated: “At present, bhikkhus, beings have come together and unite because of similarity of view.

original: Hīnādhimuttikā sattā hīnādhimuttikehi sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandanti samenti,
analyzed: hīna adhimuttikā sattā hīna adhimuttikehi sattehi saddhim sasandanti samenti
translated: Beings of low aspiration come together and unite with beings of low aspiration.

original: kalyāṇādhimuttikā sattā kalyāṇādhimuttikehi sattehi saddhiṁ saṁsandanti samentī”ti.
analyzed: kalyāṇa adhimuttikā sattā kalyāṇa adhimuttikehi sattehi saddhim sasandanti samenti iti
translated: Beings of noble aspiration come together and unite with beings of noble aspiration.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“The thicket grows through association;

analyzed: a sasaggena chijjati  parittam dārum āruyha  yathā sīde mahaṇṇave
translated: it is cut down by non-association.🔽Just as a man might board a small boat
and sink in the great ocean,
so the one of good life sinks🔽when he comes near the lazy one.
Therefore one should avoid the lazy one,🔽the one of low energy;🔽the noble ones are secluded,
concentrated, and meditators.
Always live with the wise,
with those who are energetic.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
The ninth.
